intro: Acinodendron barbinerve, commonly known as the hairy-veined acinodendron, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves with prominent, hairy veins. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by small, berry-like fruits. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
